intro: Melandrium involucratum, commonly known as the clustered catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It typically grows in meadows, woodlands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Melandrium involucratum is often found in temperate climates and is known for its delicate appearance and ecological significance.
